feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 3:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...VALDEZ GLACIER DAMMED LAKE RELEASING... Valdez Glacier Dammed Lake on the Valdez Glacier is releasing causing rises on the Valdez Glacier Lake and Stream. The Valdez Glacier Stream is currently at 20.3 ft and has risen over 3 ft since Monday morning. The event is mirroring the release a year ago and is expected to rise an additional 2-3 ft to around 22.5 ft

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:31AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Tuscaloosa and central Bibb Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 331 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coaling, or 11 miles southeast of Holt, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY WEDNESDAY... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:42PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then Increasing Winds This Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a chance of cities such as Reno (15%) and Fallon (50%) of hitting 100 degrees on Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Moving Through Northeastern Missouri... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:42PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then Increasing Winds This Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:57AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG THIS MORNING... Foggy conditions will continue through dawn for portions of northwest Pennslyvania and eastern Ohio. Visibilities will occasionally drop to a quarter mile or less, especially in valleys and low lying areas. Motorists should use caution and be prepared to slow down if they encounter fog.
